title: Eternal Gaze
description:
Eternal Gaze was my entry for the GMTK Game Jam 2025 and also my very first game jam experience. I worked on this project with Jens De Brabanter, a close friend and 3D artist I collaborate with on most of my game-related projects.

Key Research
The theme of the jam was 'loop', and we had just four days to complete the game. After some brainstorming, we came up with the idea of creating a game where your past deaths become tools for progress. This concept led us to incorporate Medusa, who petrifies Perseus whenever he is in her line of sight. The player can then use the statues left behind by their former selves as cover to advance through the level.

Results
In the end, we successfully created a project we're proud of despite the tight deadline. It was a rewarding experience, and it certainly won't be the last game jam I participate in.

title: Radio Silence
description:
In this project, I focused on developing gameplay mechanics and interactive elements for a horror puzzle game where players explore a dark, mysterious house, solve puzzles, and avoid a lurking monster. My role involved coding, while a friend from Howest created all the 3D assets.

Key Research
Particle System: Implemented a dust particle system to stregthen the immersion.
Post-Processing: Applied post-processing profiles to heighten the eerie atmosphere.

Results
The combination of post-processing, particle effects, and sound design significantly enhances the game's immersion. This project was a valuable learning experience to enhance my understanding of player immersion.

title: HOPE
description:
This project was created as the final work for my Bachelor's degree in Multimedia at Erasmushogeschool Brussel, Campus Kaai. HOPE was developed as a way to raise awareness about mental health issues and loneliness.

Key Research
My research for this project focused primarily on mental health challenges and loneliness among people in my generation. I explored how individuals cope with these issues, aiming to reflect these coping mechanisms within the game. I also studied how colors can be used to convey emotions. This knowledge helped me design environments that visually represent the protagonist's emotional journey.

Results
In the end, I applied my research to make an emotionally impactful experience that raises awareness about the importance of mental health.

title: Magic Color Mix
description:
Magic Color Mix is a 2D educational game developed in Unity during my internship at Caramel Publishing, designed to teach children the basics of color theory through interactive play. The game introduces players to primary colors red, blue, and yellow and encourages them to experiment with color combinations.

Key Research
For this project, I explored how children learn through play and visual interaction. I focused on simplifying the concepts of primary, secondary, and tertiary colors in a way that felt both intuitive and engaging. I also looked into user interface best practices for young audiences to ensure the game was accessible and easy to navigate.

Results
The final result is an interactive and playful learning experience that helps children understand color mixing through experimentation. The project combines education and entertainment in a way that's both fun and informative.

title: Counting Animals with Snow White
description:
Counting Animals with Snow White is a game I developed during my internship at Caramel Publishing. Based on the children's book 'Blanche-Neige au pays des chiffres', the game transforms the story into an interactive seek-and-find experience for young learners.

Key Research
This project focused on translating educational content from a physical book into an engaging digital format. I designed simple, intuitive mechanics where players must search for and click on one or more animals hidden within a scene. The goal was to support early counting skills while keeping the experience playful and engaging.

Results
The final game delivers a fun and educational experience that stays true to the spirit of the original book. It encourages observation and number recognition in a gentle, storybook-like environment.

title: Box Puzzle Game
description:
This project is a puzzle-based game developed in Unity, designed as my final work for the 3D Games course.

Key Features
It features dynamic object interactions, allowing players to pick up, rotate, and manipulate objects to solve puzzles. Other gameplay elements include unlocking compartments, using animations and physics-based mechanics.

Results
This was my first experience developing a game in Unity, and it proved to be an incredibly enriching journey. It allowed me to explore the many facets of game development within Unity from scripting interactions to working with physics, animation, and audio.
